relation: This command was modified in a release earlier than Cisco IOS Release 12.4(24)T. The allocating-process and dead keywords were added.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference - show gsr through show monitor event trace [Support] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description [details] ] [ chassis-info gsr show To display hardware information on the Cisco 12000 series Gigabit Switch Routers (GSRs), use the show gsr command in EXEC mode. show gsr show gsr through show monitor event trace show gsr through show monitor event trace show gsr through show monitor event trace show monitor event-trace show module show mls statistics show microcode show memory transient show memory traceback show memory statistics history show memory scan show memory processor show memory pci show memory multibus show memory lite-chunks show memory fragment show memory fast show memory failures alloc show memory events show memory ecc show memory detailed show memory debug unused
textAfterTable: Command Modes EXEC Command History Release Modification 11.2GS This command was introduced to support the Cisco 12000 series GSRs. 12.2(33)SRA This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SRA. Usage Guidelines Use this command to determine the type of hardware installed in your Cisco 12000 series GSR router. Examples The following is sample output from the show gsr command for a Cisco 12012 router. This command shows the type and state of the card installed in the slot.  Router# show gsr  Slot 0 type = Route Processor state = IOS Running MASTER Slot 7 type = 1 Port Packet Over SONET OC-12c/STM-4c state = Card Powered Slot 16 type = Clock Scheduler Card state = Card Powered PRIMARY CLOCK The following is sample output from the show gsr
